p: Characterizing the epitopes of these bnAbs on the HIV-1 Env trimers allow us to define the sites of vulnerability that should be targeted in a vaccine design [ 46, 47, 48]. These sites of vulnerability include the conserved regions near the CD4 binding site (CD4bs), the V1V2-glycan apex (V1V2g), the V3-glycan region (V3g), the gp41 membrane-proximal external region (MPER), and a complex region at the gp120-gp41 interface including the fusion peptide located at the N terminus of gp41 ( Figure 1) [ 49, 50].
